title: About Me
text:
About Me



Dr. S.V. Balasubramanian is a Postdoctoral Fellow in the Department of Biology at the University of Massachusetts Boston, USA.
He specializes in ocean color remote sensing, aquatic optics, hyperspectral imaging, and the use of machine learning for aquatic environmental monitoring.


Dr. Balasubramanian has over a decade of research experience in satellite remote sensing, optical modeling, and data-driven environmental analysis.He has worked at leading institutions including NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC), GESTAR-II/UMBC, and IIT Madras.His work bridges field observations, satellite product validation, and AI-based modeling frameworks for complex aquatic systems.



Research Interests



Ocean color remote sensing and optical property retrieval


Machine and deep learning for aquatic environment monitoring


Hyperspectral data analysis and uncertainty quantification


Atmospheric correction and bio-optical modeling


Integration of UAV, field, and satellite observations

title: Dr. S. V. Balasubramanian
text:
Dr. S. V. Balasubramanian


Postdoctoral Fellow, Department of Biology


University of Massachusetts Boston





I am a remote sensing scientist specializing in ocean satellite remote sensing and aquatic optics. Currently, I serve as a Postdoctoral Fellow at the University of Massachusetts Boston, where my work focuses on hyperspectral modeling of kelp forests and machine learning frameworks for water quality retrieval.


Previously, I held research positions at NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (UMD) and GESTAR-II, UMBC, contributing to projects on radiative transfer modeling and satellite image analysis of inland and coastal waters. I earned my Ph.D. in Ocean Engineering from IIT Madras, India, where my doctoral research focused on underwater light field modeling and optical property retrieval.


My broader research vision integrates satellite, drone, and in-situ observations with data-driven methods to better understand aquatic ecosystem processes and their variability under changing environmental conditions.

title: Research
text:
Research






Hyperspectral Modeling of Kelp Forests


Developing PRISMA-based hyperspectral models validated using UAV imagery to map kelp canopy structure and health along coastal regions. (Ongoing, UMass Boston)






Machine Learning for Water Quality Retrieval


Applying Mixture Density Networks (MDN) for estimating chlorophyll-a and turbidity from multispectral imagery in optically complex waters. (Collaboration: IIT Madras & NASA/UMBC)
